dcterms:creator: G. E. Hinton
P. Dayan
B. J. Frey
R. M. Neal
dcterms:description: The Helmholtz machine is a model that uses a wake-sleep algorithm for unsupervised learning in neural networks, where learning occurs during both wake and sleep phases.
dcterms:title: Helmholtz machine

dcterms:creator: Y. Wei
G. P. Krishnan
M. Bazhenov
dcterms:description: This dataset involves a thalamocortical network model that simulates slow waves during sleep and their synaptic mechanisms related to memory consolidation.
dcterms:title: Thalamocortical network model of slow waves

dcterms:creator: N. Deperrois
M. A. Petrovici
W. Senn
J. Jordan
dcterms:description: Generative adversarial networks (GANs) are used to learn cortical representations through a process termed 'adversarial dreaming', which involves generating and distinguishing between real and synthetic data.
dcterms:title: Generative adversarial networks (GANs)

dcterms:creator: G. Hinton
dcterms:description: Contrastive learning is a representation learning method that emphasizes the importance of embedding similar data close together while keeping dissimilar data apart.
dcterms:title: Contrastive learning

dcterms:creator: G. E. Hinton
R. R. Salakhutdinov
dcterms:description: An autoencoder is a type of neural network used to learn efficient representations of data, typically for the purpose of dimensionality reduction.
dcterms:title: Autoencoder

dcterms:creator: O. C. Gonz√°lez
Y. Sokolov
G. P. Krishnan
J. E. Delanois
M. Bazhenov
dcterms:description: This dataset examines spatiotemporal firing sequences and their role in memory protection from catastrophic forgetting during sleep.
dcterms:title: Spatiotemporal firing sequence

dcterms:creator: K. Yoshida
T. Toyoizumi
dcterms:description: Cortical slow waves are studied in the context of their role in information maximization and synaptic plasticity during non-rapid eye movement sleep.
dcterms:title: Cortical slow waves
